original: Kihlström, Enoch, redaktör, Söderköping, f. 13/11/82 i Siena, Älvsb. 1. G. 15 m. Signe Åslind. Barn: Bengt f. 17. — Kurs v. Borås tekn. vävsk., elev v. Wendelsbergs folkhögsk. 09-10. Stud:res. i uti. Medarb. i Gbgs-Pos-ten 10, i Borås-Posten 10-14, chefred, o. ansv. utg. av Söderköp.-Posten sed. 46. Sign.: E. K-m, Ekå. Led. av istadsfullm. sed. 25, dess beredn :utsk. sed. 27, dess ordf. sed. 43, kyrkiofullm^ sed. 33\, ordf. 37-46, led. av kyrkoråd 34-32 o. folksk:styr. sed. 30, "dess v. ordf. sed. 39, nämndeman sed. 47. Medl. av Publ :kl. sed. 23 o. Sv. journ:" fören. sed. 18.
translated: Kihlström, Enoch, editor, from Söderköping, born on November 13, 1882 in Siena, Älvsborg. Married once, to Signe Åslind, with whom he had a son named Bengt, born in 1917. Completed a course at Borås Technical Weaving School and was a student at Wendelsbergs Folk High School from 1909 to 1910. Went on study trips abroad. Worked as a contributor for Goteborgs-Posten in 1910, and for Borås-Posten from 1910 to 1914. Became the editor-in-chief and responsible publisher of Söderköpings-Posten since 1946. Used the initials E.K-m or Ekå as signature. Became a member of the City Council in 1925, served on its committee from 1927, was chairperson from 1943, served on the Parish Council from 1933, chaired from 1937 to 1946, served on the School Board from 1930, and was vice-chairperson from 1939, became a lay magistrate in 1947. Was a member of the Public Committee since 1923 and the Swedish Journalist Association since 1918.
